Grebner knows what's up!  I don't even think the Mackinac Center pretends to be non-partisan or independent.

Grew up in Midland and have been aware of the Mackinac Center since its inception.

I wouldn't say they outright lie, but given their partisan bent, I would suggest never relying on them to give anything close to a complete picture on any public policy issue.

Personally, I wouldn't believe them if they said the sky was blue.

I wouldn't take the Mackinac Center's report as gospel. I obtained a statement of their methodology, and it doesn't look very solid. They make a number of plausible assumptions and reasonable guesses, but they never produce a falsifiable hypothesis to compare to the real world, by which I mean an independent prediction of a quantity that can be checked to confirm the model's integrity.

Although the authors proudly display their titles as Ph. D's, their statistical competence appears fairly shaky. They repeatedly calculate linear regression models from a set of the data from 47 States, collected across 16 consecutive years, which they assume gives them roughly 750 degrees of freedom for the calculation of confidence intervals. But - of course - there is a huge problem of collinearity when using such data, and the confidence interval should actually be much wider, if it can even be calculated. That particular error wouldn't substantially affect their estimates, but it tells me that they really don't understand the statistical tools they're employing.

BTW, it's good too see PK edging back in the direction of Obama invoking the 14th Amendment, though he doesn't use that specific term. The debt ceiling is about those bills - and only those bills - which Congress, not the President, has already committed - by law - to pay. The 14th Amendment is pretty clear that not to pay these bills would be to question the full faith and credit of these United States. And that is expressly forbidden by that 14th Amendment.

I agree that the $1 trillion platinum coin option has to be kept open. But this will not be necessary. Obama asserts his obligation under the 14th Amendment, and that's it. There are some juveniles on SCOTUS who might try to overrule Obama, Scalia for one. But they're aren't five of them.
